net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.tools.generator

Class RangeValueGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.tools.generator.RangeValueGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueGenerator

    public class RangeValueGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ValueGenerator
    Generates values for each of the double parameters of the driver ranging from 0 to 1, or a floor and ceiling values that are passed to it. Generates values for each driver by slowly increasing values per each driver and adding some percentage of noise to those values. Amount of noise is determined by the noise value set when creating an instance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double ceiling
      Maximum value that will be generated by the generator.

      private int nDrivers
      Number of drivers in the range.
      private double noise
      Value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0 that determines what percentage of the values generated will be random,
      private java.util.Random random
      Pseudo random generator used to generate noise values.

    • Method Detail

      • nexDriver

        public void nexDriver()
        Informs the generator that you're done generating values for the current driver. You don't need to call it on your first driver.
        Specified by:

      • setLimits

        public void setLimits(double floor,
                      double ceiling)
        Semi Lightweight mutator method.
        Specified by:
        setLimits in interface ValueGenerator
        Parameters:
        floor - Minimum value for any value generated by this generator cannot exceed 1.0 and can't be below 0.
        ceiling - Maximum value generated by this generator. Has to be positive and cannot exceed 1.0.
